Reviews.Title: “Convenient and high quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: adjpicks
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Hotel Alfa a number of times and it remains a very convenient and consistent hotel. The rooms are very pleasant and the breakfast is excellent. There is a courtesy bus to the airport (bookable in advance) and it is very easy to get to downtown Barcelona, as there is a municipal bus which stops right outside the hotel and costs a couple of Euros.

Reviews.Title: “No frills.”
Reviews.Author: svdelosreyes
Reviews.Content: Landing in Barcelona from California to start our 2-week holiday in Spain. We stayed 2 nights in a clean but small, 2-beds room. No frills included. WiFi is free. Must pay for coffee and of course anything else. Leaving Spain to return to California we stayed another 2 nights. They assigned us a supposedly non-smoking room. Upon opening the door to the room, it was obviously a SMOKING room. Went back to the reception desk to ask for a NON-SMOKING room. The clerk claimed that the room he gave us was non-smoking. He finally believed us and gave us another room which was a non-smoking room. However, it was not swept up for dust bunnies. The bathroom was clean and the beds were okay. The free shuttle to and from the airport was why we booked our rooms here. The driver is usually not tipped by European vacationers and that's the reason the driver is reluctant to assist in loading luggages into the van.

Reviews.Title: “Good out of the way hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dennis Y
Reviews.Content: Shuttle was on time to pick me up from the airport. The driver, despite of the late hour, was courteous. The elder man at the reception was very tired and had my next day's wake up call registered for the night of arrival. It was at 4 AM. There is a free wi-fi, which is great. They have a self-serve mini store, where you can pick up water, other drinks and things to eat and pay at the reception. Not bad. It's a clean hotel and very comfortable for those with late arrivals and early departures.

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: wimpdiver
Reviews.Content: Stayed here b/c of an early flight but it doesn't really save any time - better to take an extra 15 minutes and enjoy your last night (or first night) in town and take the airport bus/train directly to the airport sinrce this hotel is 15 minutes from the airport by shuttle AFTER you wait 30 minutes for the suttle schedule! The Good Rooms are clean Staff speak English well (if this matters to you) BUT they are rude and lie (eg asked for shuttle reserv at 15 past the hour - no problem. When I arrived the next day I was told shuttle is only every 30 minutes - why couldn't they have told me that when I made the reservation? When I asked about Diamond amenity staff looked at me like I was insane (not a pleasant experience) The BAD There is an indoor pool but it is not appealing and MUCH smaller than it appears in the photos, You'd have to walk through lobby and up a dark area to get to pool then trek back through lobby in wet suit:( Pool size means you could do one or maybe 2 strokes if swimming, but I guess okay if you want to walk in the pool. Any problem is met with a total lack of concern. the 3 English channels (BBC, CNN) all didn't work and staff made no attempt to fix just "we'll have to call them in the am". Doesn't do me any good tonight :( Not even an apology. Hotel restaurant is open ? hours and looked expensive - no place anywhere nearby to eat so beware. NO soundproofing of walls or doors so be prepared to hear people talking, etc as they walk down the narrow hallway. All in all the staff act as if guests are an annoyance they would rather avoid. Quite a contrast from the BW Dante I had just left where everyone went out of their way to be helpful.

Reviews.Title: “disappointed”
Reviews.Author: TINNE1989
Reviews.Content: Every year me and a group of my friends go to the benicassim festival, and on the last night we will have a long day of travelling back to Barcelona to stay over night and travel back home the next day. Bearing in mind we have been camping for 10 days, we are all very much looking forward to have a relaxing time in the hotel being waited upon. We stayed at the best western 2 years in a row, the first year was fine, as most of us went to bed an hour after arriving so not much could go wrong. Last year was very different. There was a problem with my remote, so when going downstairs to ask for another one, the same one that was in every other room, they refused, said I had to have what I was given and sent a cleaner that didnt speak any english up to my room to look at the remote. At the restaurant, half of us were given the wrong food and they refused to take it back, one vegetarian was given meat even though she asked what was in it before hand and was told it was just pasta and tomatoes, and when trying to tell them she was told to 'shhush'. I know other things went wrong with other people but I dont think there is enough room to put it all down here. For a hotel that is used for people travelling to and from the airport, they seemed to hate tourist. We are not fussy, we weren't expecting 5*, just a bit of common courtisy. (The only good thing I have to say about this stay is that the rooms were really nice)

Reviews.Title: “Airport convenience”
Reviews.Author: wing2799
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel after a cruise because of the proximity to the airport. Hotel has a free shuttle to the airport but reserve as soon as you check in as it was over booked and some people had to wait for another shuttle or the one we were on to return. Quiet wasn't a problem as it's in the middle of an industrial district. The rooms were large enough but a little rough around the edges. Bathroom was clean and had a large shower. The hotel is not within walking distance of anything. However, there is a bus that stops right in front of the hotel that takes you into Barcelona. The last stop once in Barcelona, and the one you have to return to to get back to the hotel, is about a 20-25 minute walk to some of the main tourist areas (Ramblas). For the price it was adequate for our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Another vote for "you get what you pay for"”
Reviews.Author: SheilaW34
Reviews.Content: We left the car at the hotel during our holiday in the Canaries, so spent 2 separate nights there. In each case, the room was fine except for the shower: 1 was very dangerously slippery, the other flooded the bathroom floor. The beds were really comfortable but there was a lot of noise from other rooms and in the corridor. The common areas, with the exception of reception and the small garden, were not so good. We took one look at the restaurant prices and went into the "zone franca" (through a checkpoint but nobody worried) for a cheap and cheerful meal at a self-service restaurant with a hilarious machine-translated menu. The bar food at the hotel was appalling - totally tasteless sandwiches at a crazy price. We had a look at the pool, which was tiny but surprisingly warm. Not at all inviting though to go through cellars etc to get to it. Shame it's being wasted. Staff were all fine except that the bar was often left unmanned. The shuttle was useful, though it takes a long time. We rang for it from the airport and were not asked to give name or number of persons. The driver picked us up, then we waited for others who never materialised - I think that was us! One important thing to note: access can be very difficult as it's close to lights on a busy main road. We had to go past on the opposite side of the road, round the roundabout and back, but we still went into the service area instead of the main entrance - not a good move!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: talesofaturkey
Reviews.Content: Chose to stay here because of a late arrival and early departure the next day. It was the cheapest and offered a free shuttle from the airport (how great!).We arrived after 10pm with a ton of other people after waiting for the free shuttle for 40 minutes. Front desk staff was rude. Hotel was dingy. Room smelled like either a raccoon had died in the bathtub or Aunt Sally just got a perm on the bed. You get what you pay for i guess. Stay here only if money is the only deciding factor.

Reviews.Title: “Forget the shuttle service ! They dont care, you probably stay a night.”
Reviews.Author: compajet
Reviews.Content: Why to choose a hotel airport....the shuttle of course. The frequency of their shuttle is every 45 minutes (and they write they have the closest hotel with the airport). With a 45 min frequency, you never know when the shuttle is supposed to be at the airport. (By the way, during these 50 minutes i saw 3 times the shuttle of Renaissance, 2 times the one of Tryp and Fira Congress). The funny part of that is that the Tryp and the Fira use the same shuttle company than Alfa...but probably they pay more in order to have a better frequency! When you call the hotel...they always say, it comes in 10 minutes. I waited 50 minutes....in Terminal 1. Then you go to terminal 2....and wait. Then to the hotel....my problem is that the driver received a call to go back to the airport because some crew members arrived. They dont respect their clients except crew members! I arrived at the hotel after 1h20 minutes....I understood from the driver that in fact there is no schedule because he often receives some calls to go there or there immediatly. The hotel is in the middle of nowhere....but its true that there is a bus stop 30 meters. Nothing around. I had the room at the end of a corridor...so no internet signal or sometimes but very poor. My room was 30 meters to a highway toll....so my room was noisy. The mattress was terrible....the worst of the last 10 years. Except that...the hotel looks great. Spend 10 euros more and stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “You Get What You Pay For”
Reviews.Author: escapeorlando
Reviews.Content: It was pretty cheap so for one night it worked out just fine. I would not stay there for any length of time though. The room had a smell to it - kind of like our linens had been in a smoky room. Think the AC had been turned off for the year so I opened the window to cool the room off and air it out. We did take advantage of the free aiport shuttle which was the readon behing staying there. Not very exciting but it works.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: danimary
Reviews.Content: Freindly staff at reception, free shuttle to and from the airport, comfortable bed and an amazing bathroom! Somewaht noisy at night as this hotel is smack dab in the middle of an industrial area. No ac to cool the room down (common theme it seems for November in Barca) so we had to keep the window open. All in all, worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably-priced hotel, near airport but with convenient public bus to city!”
Reviews.Author: maestrolms
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this pleasant, newer hotel for two nights in late November, 2011, before embarking on a cruise from Barcelona to Fort Lauderdale. I chose the property because it was a Best Western and also could be booked through Hotels.Com, two of my favorite travel resources. The hotel offers a free shuttle every half hour during daylight hours; it is only about 10 minutes from the airport. The great advantage is that Public Busline #21 stops just by the hotel, and for €1.45 will take you to the heart of downtown Barcelona, near the Columbus monument. This bus runs seven days a week until about 11 PM. Taxi fare to the same area is €22-26 from the hotel, so take the bus if you have the time. The hotel is located in a rather industrial area, so the environment knocks my rating down from a 5 to a 4! The room was of average size; the beds VERY comfortable; the bath very spiffy, with an almost luxury shower/tub area. Breakfast was NOT included with the room; a continental breakfast was €4.95 and a full breakfast with hot meat, eggs, etc., was €14.95. I found this hotel to be a convenient two-night stopover before my Transatlantic cruise; and was able to spend one of the days with a very enjoyable full-day tour out in the countryside. (See separate review about Spanish Trails Adventure...highly recommended!)

Reviews.Title: “Airport hotel - not more”
Reviews.Author: Abal1
Reviews.Content: Very friendly reception and bar staff. Easy to be reached from airport, even if cab costs app. 10€, but also hotel-shuttle each hour at half for free. Free WiFi is available in every room. Spent there two nights, unfortunately the traffic is heavy at the lights just in front of the hotel and there where always people on the floor shouting. My manicure set disappeared during the day, the hotel staff did not do anything about my complaint - but it was anyhow very old...

Reviews.Title: “Not easy to reach, lover level than expected”
Reviews.Author: VitPetersburg
Reviews.Content: We had booked two rooms at this hotel by the "blind" booking on one of the booking sites, looking at the hotel description we were pleased with the price /offer relations. Yet there was something we have not been aware of. The hotel itself as rather away from the airport and the promised shuttle bus is running only for sertain time of the day - so when we arrived to the airport shortly after 23.00 we had no chance to get the shuttle and had to use the cab. According to some rules the minimum ride costs at Barcelona airport is 20 euro (it turns to be 22 to the hotel!!!) so be very careful for this extra cost. We have arrived to the hotel and the not too friendly night portier checked us in, explaining that whatever we want is also extra cost. At the same time he has refused to the group of other waiting persons telling that hotel is full - so keep this in mind when you have no booking (yet the "street" cost for the room is relatively high for the area and service). At the rooms you have pretty basic level - yet few could be defenitly improved already at the first site - bar fridge was not running, TV had only Spanish chanels and there were nothing extra you may expect from the Best Western Hotel level. Extra disappointing was the bathroom and the shower - the bath tap you may not use is you are not phisically in the bath tub - i.e. you need to get undressed and take you socks off get in switch the water, make your feet wet and get off - or may be they ment not to use the tub. The shower itself was leacking in a few spots - that made it hard to use - so overall the bath / shower unit was relativelly poor for four stars even in Spain and for sure not up to Best Western Standsrds. The shuttle to the airport is running every half an hour - so keep it in mind (especially taking into acount that it is ca 15 minutes ride!). The very last point was that the day portier was not accepted my Frequent Flyer card saying that is not accepted here only the Best Western Cards are running, which made a single night stay complete with the cherry on the top. My recomendation - unless it is extremely cheap for money or you have no chance to stop over in the area - avoid this hotel - there are better in the area and in the city which is off 10 more minutes. I also would recomend the chain to check some points at this one. My conclusion - not the best experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent airport hotel with fantastic logistics”
Reviews.Author: Totti K
Reviews.Content: With annual 200+ travel days, I sometimes run into a hotel that has nothing fancy but EVERYTHING WORKS and all that they promise on the website is 100% true. Best Western Alfa Aeropuerto is one of these hotels. Nothing fancy, one restaurant, one small shop for hotel customers, basic room with a bed, tv and wireless. I came to the hotel late one evening with the intention of continuing from Barcelona the next morning. The hotel shuttle was ready when I stepped out of the airport, travel to hotel took 15-20 minutes due to two separate pick-ups, check in went smoothly, room was clean, shower had good water pressure and plenty of hot water. I managed to get some snacks from hotel shop and the next morning all things went smoothly when checking out. I would not consider this hotel for a city vacation in Barcelona, but for an over-night stay while in transit, this hotel was simply great, exactly what you need and nothing more, nothing less.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: DanielJamesVictoria
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because it was apparently close to the airport and it had a shuttle. We rang the hotel when we landed and received excellent clear instruction in english. From there we had an efficient check in and the bar was still open for a late night snack and drink. From where we had come from the room was spotless and terrific - great bathroom, excellent bed and linen and the windows opened if you wanted fresh air rather than airconditioning. And then we had an early return shuttle the next morning to the airport, only held up by inconsiderate late passengers. I would definitely recommend this for an overnight stay close to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “To me, service is everything. Here...it was AWFUL!”
Reviews.Author: scek55
Reviews.Content: The location is very very good if you only want to be close to the airport. However, if you want to eat local dishes or go sight-seeing, this is not the place to stay. There is nothing close by to do or eat without taking a bus or taxi. My major issue with this hotel was that although the lobby monitor screens and the room booklets advertised a welcoming and helpful staff, I found the staff to be the exact opposite. (1) Dinner Example: we stood at the hotel restaurant to be seated for about 5 minutes (only two tables occupied and no one waiting in line before us) and after the waiter and waitress walked by us about 4 times (completely ignoring us) we tried to walk to a nearby restaurant. We asked the receptionist for directions how to get to this other recommended restaurant (the lobby monitors say that they love providing helpful maps and directions for these types of recommendations) and were told to go around the corner for about 200 meters (as they point their finger, then continue doing desk work). However, around the corner looks like you're passing into private territory with a gate and toll booths for cars, so we didn't dare pass it. The second time we asked the receptionist, he said it was 300 meters PAST the toll booth gate, then ran away from us (literally). (2) Other Service Example: The booklets in the room indicated that if we needed any additional toiletries, adapters, chargers, etc. we only needed to ask and they would provide it to us free of charge (sounds like a great convenience, right?). However, when I go to the receptionist to ask for an extra bath sponge, I am told that we are only allowed 1/room (however, two people share a room...how does that work, exactly?), and he refused to give us another one. Maybe we caught the entire staff on an off-night, but overall the service at this hotel was AWFUL. The AC eventually started working and the bathrooms were new and modern, so if you don't care about service and only want a place to stay close to the airport (that offers free airport shuttle service), then this is the place to go. Otherwise, STAY SOMEWHERE ELSE!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay near Barcelona Airport”
Reviews.Author: Larry K
Reviews.Content: Our flight from Barcelona, Spain to New York City was cancelled due to Hurricane Irene and we were "stranded" for 4 days waiting for the first available flight out ... my company booked us into the Alfa and it was a really good and comfortable place to "hang out" while waiting for our flight ... they even sent their shuttle van to pick us up at another airport hotel where we had ended up at first ... they are geared to the air traveler and have a great restaurant and full bar with excellent food and great service for breakfast, lunch and dinner with user-friendly hours and reasonable prices ... plus a nice outdoor terrace where they serve a BBQ lunch daily - they provide a great, free shuttle to and from the airport and they provide free wifi in all rooms plus a convenient business center in the lobby where you can print out your boarding passes ... front desk service is friendly and helpful and they provide most everything you would need EXCEPT room service and luggage porters (they provide a small luggage cart) ... the A/C was OK, but not as powerful as Americans might expect ... nice flat screen TV in room, 'tho channel selection is quite limited, especially in English, and the shower is so complicated that it requires a tutorial on how to use it ... but there is a great, cheap local bus that stops right at the hotel that takes you into the center of Barcelona and back 24 hours daily... a great feature since the industrial area where the hotel is located offers nothing and Barcelona is just 20 minutes away ...

Reviews.Title: “much better than expected”
Reviews.Author: AA3000
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of its proximity to the airport and the free shuttle, but it turned out to be much nicer and more convenient than we thought. great free wifi, nice modern/clean shower, big bed, efficient, yet VERY INEXPENSIVE.

Reviews.Title: “Fair hotel”
Reviews.Author: pstinson5
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel at the end of our vacation because it was close to the airport. We had no real complaints other than the air conditioner in my kids room never worked, so they were pretty hot all night. The rooms are large and clean. The staff was friendly. They had a free shuttle to the airport, but it doesnt start until 5 am. We had a early fight, so we rented a taxi to come pick us up because we thought that might be cutting it close. This hotel is out in the middle of an industrial park, in the middle of no where. And should probably only be used for a one night layover. We did order room service. Ha, that was a joke! We ordered two sandwiches. The turkey sanwich came on two pieces of white bread and had two very thin slices of turkey on it. Same thing with the ham sandwich, no meat at all. Very expensive, for nothing. They do have a resturant but the prices are really high. You are kind of at their mercy, because there are no other resturants near by. Overall, it suited our needs for one night. But, if I went back to Barcelona, I doubt I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and will come back again”
Reviews.Author: Irene_Hannover
Reviews.Content: Great service and very friendly and helpful staff. The room was very nice, modern and clean. Free shuttle to the airport and also the hotel is very close to the airport. It is a great hotel and I will stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay and easy to get around”
Reviews.Author: Wildman_Aussie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights as it was close to the airport, they offered free transport to/from airport and also the price. We arrived early and the very helpful staff got us into a room pretty quick so we could have a rest after an all night flight Omar in the restaurant was a star and very helpful. The rooms are quite modern and comfortable. The wifi was good however there were no english TV channels to be found and there was no tea/coffee making facilites. The shower however was great. We were a little disappointed that there were only single beds in the room We went out every day by bus. The first trip you will have to pay 1.45 euros but once you get in town buy a Metro 10 (T10) trip pass (10 rides) from the metro station 8.25 euro. This is a great way to get around as you can catch buses and trains on the same ticket as long as it is within 1.25 hours of journey commencement. If you walk out of the hotel and turn right there is a bus stop 20 metres away and catch bus 21 straight into town. If you jump off the bus at parallel you can catch the metro train and also the fenicular railway up to Montjuic (you can use the metro 10 ticket on that too) You can also catch the 109? bus which takes you a different route to town and for this one you need to turn left from hotel, turn left into the toll booth and walk down about 1/2 way into the markets where you will find the bus stop If you are looking for a good meal within walking distance to the hotel (see directions above to the 109 bus) but on the left side you will see some restaurants , turn left down towards the banks and you will find a small restaurant here called Boviscum El Grill. Xavi (Xavier) the restaurant owner here speaks enough english to make sure you dont starve and the food is excellent (tell him Daniel sent you). I think he is open 6-6 (6 days) We would have no hesitation staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean good for a night stayover”
Reviews.Author: Sangita76
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for 2 night stay before our flight back from Spain to India. Positives -Near to Airport -Shuttle runs every half an hour for airport pick ups. Once you are at the designated spot just call the hotel. -Neat Clean and comfortable. -Free Wi fi in rooms lobby and seperate Mac computer available as well (of the 2 only one worked as long as were there) -Buses for going to city centre and stops are right next to the hotel. Negatives -Food menu is limited and pretty expensive. Buffet Breakfast is 14 EUR pp. -Pretty secluded area with no restaurants /shops in vicinity - No subway connectivity.So if you have to go from any other stop apart from where bus stops,you have to shift to Subway. Not quite comfortable. -While coming back from bus you need to know the exact name of stop as we had difficulty there are many stops with similar name. -No coffee tea machines Overall this hotel is a very good option for people doing a stay over between airport travels or connecting flights to catch. If you have a long stay in Barcelona the location is definitely an issue,so prefer something in the city instead.Even though we stayed only for 2 nights we did feel the location pinch.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, Clean, Close to Airport; Somewhat Remote”
Reviews.Author: mrfarenheit
Reviews.Content: My wife, my young son and I stayed here for one night at the end of a cruise, before flying home. We noticed other cruise passengers staying here as well, because of the close proximity to the airport. The best features of the hotel are the price (especially through AAA) and the location near the airport. It also offers decent free wi-fi and a business centre with Mac computers. There is a small indoor pool deep in the basement, and a bar and restaurant. The rooms are basic, the beds are firm. The hotel chain website indicated in-room coffee, but this was not the case. The location of the hotel near the airport is also a negative, because it is in an industrial area and there are no shops or other restaurants anywhere close by. The restaurant prices are unreasonably high, so we declined to eat there. We stayed on a Sunday when most shops and restaurants are closed, so we took a bus to eat in a busier area. Fortunately, there is a bus stop in front of the hotel that offers convenient service to downtown.

Reviews.Title: “A Decent stay”
Reviews.Author: Kusal S
Reviews.Content: The hotel in itself was good. Clean & comfortable rooms, good service etc. Definitely not 5-star but good value for money. Only drawback was that it was quite a distance from the rest of the city in a secluded area. As there is nothing else to do in the hotel or the immediate area, traveling is certainly an issue.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the Price”
Reviews.Author: michelegut
Reviews.Content: Hello, I just wanted to write to say for the price of this hotel it is worth the stay. We had 3 rooms here for the check in of June 3rd. We checked in at 11am and the front desk gentlemen could not have been more pleasant and efficient although very reserved. He had a very calm nautrue about him even with many guests waiting for him to check them in/out. He worked with us to obtain the best room types for our group and he was excellent!! The hallways are kind of an ugly yellow color but the rooms themselves are very nicely furnished and a good size for European standards. The free internet is invaluable to us since most of us are in the Technology Business. The food is OK. Not bad, not great. Soda and coffee is a little pricey. The mini bar in the room is less expensive and very convenient. The bus to 2 blocks from Las Ramblas and the Marina, the very active center of Barcelona stops right in front of the hotel. OK for the bad comment, the shuttle bus driver was the worst I have ever encountered in any airport hotel in the world and we travel a lot! We had one guest with an electric wheelchair and I asked the driver not to put luggage in the van until we got the chair in first. He ignored me and put the luggage anyway. When the chair came down the elevator and out to the van it would not fit. He refused to take out the luggage and try to work with us to get the wheelchair and luggage in so my Husband and I had to unpack all suitcases including those that did not belong to our party, put the wheelchar in and then all the luggage in again. It all fit just fine but he was very RUDE, inconsiderent and defiant. This was a terrible end to a great stay. If it wasn't for the shuttle bus driver, I would have given this hotel a 5 circle rating. Instead I give it 4 circles. All in all the front desk service and the room layout would defineitly encorage me to be a repeat customer at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible location, terrible service.”
Reviews.Author: TSRuff
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on an overnight between Marbella and flying home. The hotel is located in an industrial park with nothing nearby, no restaurants, etc. To get downdown is a 20 euro cab ride or a 45 minute bus ride. When we arrived the staff was very rude and they took several phone calls during our check-in. The key machine was broken and apparently they only have one, so se were instructed to "go wait by the hotel room and we will be let in". Several problems with this, including that we could have been standing outside of any hotel room and the staff would have let you in as they never checked anything, along with the fact that the room requires a key for the TV, lights, etc. to work, plus they never told us our room number. The beds are in bad shape and make you roll to the middle because they are worn out, and the pillows smell moldy. The hotel may have gone through a major remodel just a few years ago but it has not been maintained. I recommend you look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL”
Reviews.Author: rjjmp1292
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Barcelona for a cruise a day early. We choose this hotel based on price and we were not disappointed. Upon arrival at the airport were was a free shuttle to the hotel waiting for us. The check in process was very quick and the room was extremely clean and ready for our arrival. The resturant on the first floor served a great breakfast buffet and the hotel also arranged a cab to pick us up to take us the the port.

Reviews.Title: “Top-notch service”
Reviews.Author: Gestalt1973
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights and the room was comfortable and clean. The service was very kind. The best was the free shuttle they offer to the airport. You only have to reserve it at the check-in and they will tell you the hours available. A taxi to the airport would cost about 22 euros and you could save them using this service provided by the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Some improvements would make this even better”
Reviews.Author: RMD_11
Reviews.Content: Hotel was booked as it was handy to the airport and reasonably priced. I was impressed by the quality of the rooms for the price. I'd to print off boarding passes for flying home - no problems. Booking in staff (Manuel) was brilliant, very helpful, friendly and professional. On the down side, at Terminal 2, the shuttle bus doesn't stop right at the sign for the Hotel. As a result I was waiting for over an hour and had to make several phone calls. Really not good as I was with my parents who are in their 80's. If you are going yourself, check about 50m away in the direction of Terminal 2(C). Other things that would improve it would be a better selection of TV channels with other languages or movies. Also the "basic" breakfast is just a bit too basic. These points however would not prevent me returning or recommending the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible customer Service”
Reviews.Author: marten_1980
Reviews.Content: Nice that they have a free shuttle service to the airport (that's why you stay at a hotel near the airport. Not so nice is that they are not able to indicate from where it goes and that when you need it it is full and no substitute is offered other than, well then you have to wait for the next one in 45 min

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money !”
Reviews.Author: SusanCJ13
Reviews.Content: The free airport shuttle was excellent and the check in/ out was fast . We had 3 rooms for 1 night, all of which were very comfortable and very clean ! The bathrooms were of an excellent standard. Overall standard of hotel was very good. The staff at front desk were very efficient . We didnt have time to experience the restaurant and swimming pool, but everything looked very inviting. There is a bus stop right outside the hotel that takes you to the ' La Rambla ' area in the centre. Journey time about 25 mins and 1.45 euro ! We were in Barcelona for the Justin Bieber concert at the Palau de Sant Jordi arena, a taxi cost 14 euros and took about 15 mins. So we were happy with the choice of hotel and it was excellent value for money . Just one small thought...it would have been nice to have coffee and tea in the rooms. However,It is available downstairs (free of charge )

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, with a Smile :)”
Reviews.Author: Geographyguy97
Reviews.Content: The complimentary hotel shuttle to, and from the airport was superb. The driver was courteous, polite, and very friendly. The drive from the airport to the hotel only takes about 10 minutes. The hotel staff was also very nice. Very friendly front desk staff and management. The hotel was clean, and modern looking inside. This hotel has a fully equipped bar and restaurant inside. The rooms have very comfortable beds, and big flat panel TV set, which I enjoyed. The shower was very hard to figure out, however. The bus stop that takes your to Barcelona's city center and attractions was very convenient. It's located right outside the door, basically. It takes approximately 20-30 minutes of travel time by bus, however to city center. I didn't enjoy that much. The worst thing about this hotel is there is NO vending machines for soda's or water refreshments. This is much needed! The only way to get something to drink is buy something from the minibar for 3 Euros! OR... spend 3 Euros at the bar in the restaurant! Overall, I recommend this hotel, simply because the staff is great, the shuttle is very convenient, and the rooms are comfortable and pleasant. The free Wifi internet is also very nice!

Reviews.Title: “Far from city center--bus stop near but dangerous at night.”
Reviews.Author: JAVISYL
Reviews.Content: Restaurant was empty most of the time. Atmosphere not friendly. Never had food aromas as an incentive to enter the restaurant. Bar tender at night unfriendly. Hotel staff did not make me feel comfortable and welcomed. Francisco the shuttle driver very friendly, courteous and provided excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: albibalu
Reviews.Content: Nice Stay, Nice Staff and Good Breakfast, Quite sorounding good night sleep after a long flight

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: Leese_T
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a quick stay near the airport, this is the place to stay. The hotel offers a free shuttle from the airport to the hotel every 20 minutes or so, and this will certainly save you on taxi fare! To get downtown is about a 30 minute bus ride, but the plus side is the bus stop is right in front of the hotel and the ride only costs you 1,45Euro each way, as opposed to a taxi, which I estimate would cost at least 40 Euro or more each way! The hotel is clean, although not in a great area, and there is really nothing nearby. They do have a pool for your enjoyment, and the staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: munsterforever
Reviews.Content: I rang the Hotel and the free shuttle was there in 2 minutes! The breakfast was good and the Room was perfectly adequate and quite large. The reception Staff were friendly and gave my little girl sweets and stuff to draw on. There is plenty of information on how to get into Town at the Hotel and if we were visiting Barcelona we would stay here and travel in.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: buferaf77
Reviews.Content: Perfect solution for people travelling by plane. Free shuttle service from&to the airport. Clean, nice rooms, good service.The room was excellent value for money

Reviews.Title: “Family Room was Amazing”
Reviews.Author: madisonthom
Reviews.Content: We were only looking for a hotel near the airport in Barcelona to stay the night, and what we found was one of the nicest hotels of our Spain trip. Upon opening the door, we were greeted with a hallway of original art. At the end of the hallway was a master bedroom to the left, a huge bathroom with a tub that really was a small swimming pool in front of us, and a second small bedroom to the right. We were going to go into the city that evening, but ended up staying in the hotel, because the room was so nice. Internet was free, there was a refrigerator and mini-bar in the room, and seemingly everything had been thought of. We wished we could have stayed on. And, all of this for $124 Euros!

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel convenient for airport and city centre”
Reviews.Author: jmfcambridge
Reviews.Content: Good airport hotel with free shuttle service - although this does go to the new terminal one first which is some distance from the hotel, the old terminal two (Easyjet use this terminal) is much closer. Rooms are quite small but clean and modern - bathrooms are nice and well equipped Bar is comfortable but we did not use the restaurant. Most of the staff were polite and helpful but the shuttle bus driver was quite surly. There is a bus stop directly outside the hotel and the number 21 bus takes you right to the city centre - the buses go every half hour and the cost of each journey is about 1.4 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Do not be deceived by the Alfa's promo rate...”
Reviews.Author: CharmCollector
Reviews.Content: Do not be deceived by the Alfa's promotional rate. Because this hotel is isolated in the midst of a large industrial area , taxi fare to reach an off-site restaurant will vastly outweigh the value of any savings you might have expected from the low room rate. Alfa knows this and gouges their "guests" in its on-site restaurant where a cup of tea will cost you 4.8 euros!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific!”
Reviews.Author: lemonemclean
Reviews.Content: Our group of 10 people had the best accommodations at the hotel alfa. We were given tips on how to get into the town and what sights to see. The hotel was very clean and quite, in fact I believe our group was the noisiest! The food, from breakfast to dinner was excellent along with the wait service. The hotel staff overall was very friendly, patient and knowledgeable. As we had some language barrier there was some confusion but the staff handled themselves admirably, especially Luis and Jose at the service desk. Thank you for making our stay in Barcelona a memorable one! We will recommend your hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for airport proximity”
Reviews.Author: Sjblade
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for its location, as we were flying into Barcelona from Mallorca late that evening and flying overseas the following morning. Unfortunately, beware that the hotel shuttle is not as frequent as the surrounding hotels. We had to wait approximately 45 minutes for the shuttle, which seemed like a long time after a flight. The hotel itself was a pleasant surprise. It was clean and had modern amenities. We were somewhat dissappointed that there were no English speaking channels on television but for one night, it was no big deal. The hotel restaurant was decent and we enjoyed a late meal there. The shuttle back to the airport the following morning was convenient. All in all, a great value!.

Reviews.Title: “Good design and convenient location for early flight”
Reviews.Author: Cheskabrit
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised by the design and quality of this hotel. I got the bargain price of 65 Euro for a pre-paid reservation and was not expecting much more than a bed and airport transfer. The room was well designed and spacious. There was even a small swimming pool and sauna that was a welcome amenity after a long day. There were several toiletries in the bath including a comb, shampoo and gel, a shoeshine cloth and a packet of tissues. The reception staff was attentive and took my reservation for the airport shuttle and wake up call upon check in. There is an internet station in the lobby and a selection of newspapers, magazines and books. Nice touches. Free Wi-Fi throughout. Another nice touch. There is a small bar and restaurant and room service is available. Prices are a bit high but not outrageous (15-25 per entree or 10 for a pizza). The wake up call was right on time and the shuttle was too. All in all a very pleasant visit. The hotel is in an industrial area and difficult to find - even for my taxi driver. I did not see any other airport hotels nearby.

Reviews.Title: “OK for a Night”
Reviews.Author: Tikibird
Reviews.Content: The shuttle actually left me a bad impression as it is supposed to be every 45 minutes but we JUST missed one and waited over an hour for the next one. By comparison, the TRYP Hotel one was like every 20 minutes. Then the driver hops out for a smoke before taking us to the hotel! Reception took no notice that I am Platinum elite with BW and got no perks or anything. Room was OK, didn't notice the AC as I don't really care for AC's. There is a bus right outside to get to Paralel Station where you can get a metro anywhere else. It's a long way from downtown. Free wifi. Shuttle back to airport the next morning was on time.

Reviews.Title: “Poor customer service. Not near airport. Stay at Marriott Renaisannce”
Reviews.Author: rosemc2
Reviews.Content: We arrive around midnight to check in. The room we were given was furnished adequately, but the AC did not work. Only the heat worked. The night staff claimed no other rooms were available and that the AC was actually working (despite the thermostat indicating heat and the room being hot). The room was around 95 deg F. The window did open...only to hear the idling of semis in the parking lot behind the hotel. Staff was completely unappologetic. Definately recommend you stay at another "airport" hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel if you ride the shuttle. Impossible to find by car.”
Reviews.Author: caribbeanlovers10
Reviews.Content: Very nice newer (5-10 years) hotel with high end modernistic bathrooms and décor. Well maintained and clean. English speaking staff. If you are taking a cruise shuttles or just using the shuttles to and from the airport, this is a great hotel, just don’t take rooms 101, 201, 301 etc., as they are on the corner facing the truck entrance gate to the shipyard. Warning! If you are arriving by car, this hotel is near impossible to find. We’ve scanned in a hotel supplied map and attached it as a picture. Internet map and Garmin (2009) locations are not correct as of Sept. 2010! We spent 30 minutes driving in circles looking for it even after calling the hotel. Then it was 8 Euros to park the car.

Reviews.Title: “Overated”
Reviews.Author: Savvy-traveller010
Reviews.Content: This overated hotel is at best a two stars' hotel and is unworthy of the Best Western's branding. It is located next to a trucking/shipping courtyard and our room view was facing piles of trucks` trailers and shipping containers. The bathroom has been renovated but the corridors' walls are in a desperate need of a fresh paint. The mattress and sheets have known better days and are in need of upgrade. Noise came out of the others rooms. The restaurant only opened at 20h30 and is overpriced. Service was unfriendly and personnel wasn't customer-oriented. An experience to forget at all costs!

Reviews.Title: “a superb airport hotel. would recommend to everyone”
Reviews.Author: KABE
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Best Western Alfa Aeropuerto hotel twice in Dec. I chose this hotel initially as the price was very reasonable and the close proximity to the airport was what i needed. There is a courtesy mini bus that takes you to and from the airport which operated frequently. The driver was very pleasant and assisted me with all my luggage. Check in was quick and efficient with friendly staff. I was pleasantly surpised with my room - it exceeded my expectations. Was very comfortable and modern and the shower was absolutely fantastic. I knew i was staying at this hotel again the following week due to my inconvenient flight times and was thoroughly looking forward to it again. I can not fault this hotel at all, if you do need to stay in an airport hotel at Barcelona, please select this one, trust me you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: oompahdave
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Best Western Alfa twice on our trip and found it to be a good choice that more than met our needs. We arrived from a cruise ship in mid morning and had to wait only a few minutes before a room was cleaned and we were given an early check in. The next day we were off to Rome and used the free airport shuttle. Following our five days in Rome, we caught the pick up shuttle at the airport, stayed one more night, then back to the airport early the next morning on the shuttle. Front desk staff and the shuttle driver were friendly and helpful. We had both a breakfast buffet in the restaurant one morning (not free and somewhat pricy) and dinner our last night. The food was good and it was convenient. That's fortunate, as there are no other dining options nearby. The Alfa is in a waregouse/shipping area, with nothing else around it to see or do. Twice cab drivers from the center city area didn't know where the hotel was located and had trouble finding it. Taxi fare to/from center city is approximately 25 Euro. There is a bus stop right outside which we took to center city for 1,40 Euro. The hotel itself is undistinguished modern, but is clean and comfortable. Public areas are good and there is free WiFi throughout the hotel, a real plus. The bathrooms are very modern, European style. The beds were comfortable. Room rates were very reasonable, much cheaper than center city tourist hotels.. Most people probably wouldn't choose to stay here except as a stopping point between flights, but for that purpose it is an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot recommend the food”
Reviews.Author: MarkSheen
Reviews.Content: Counter staff was not helpful and found the food was barely edible.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel near airport”
Reviews.Author: JPfan
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel the night before we flew home from Barcelona and I can't recommend it enough! The hotel provides free shuttle service to and from the airport, free internet, free fitness center. The staff is polite and helpful. Restaurant and bar are both comfortable and offer good food and drinks. The room was spacious, clean, quiet, and comfortable. Great place to stay before a long flight home.

Reviews.Title: “Hot or Noisy”
Reviews.Author: Vine999
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night. We had a corner room on an upper floor and were pleased to see that we had an open view from our windows and total privacy. The WiFi worked just fine and there was a flat screen TV. However, the room was very warm and there was a sign not to touch the thermostat. It was cool outside, so we opened all the windows which made the room temperature very comfortable. We went to bed with the windows open.....however, there was a highway intersection beneath us and the traffic noise woke us up often during the night. At 5:00am we closed the windows, which made the room absolutely quiet, but very hot. I wanted to use the safe as we were planning to tour Barcelona, but it looked as though it was taped closed and there was a note to see the Management if we wanted use of the safe, so we didn't bother. The restaurant was quite expensive.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel near the airport”
Reviews.Author: Qreall
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel by car. check in took about 1-2 minutes and then we were already in his room. Convenient parking is unfortunately not given a free night at around 8 euros. Clean spacious rooms with excellent bathroom. Responsible personnel to respond quickly to emerging issues. A good restaurant is a pity that the choice of food is not great. The only downside, the hotel is located in an industrial area in connection with this early beginning the noise from cars. Due to the fact that the airport is located near the airport is very convenient for the nights before the flight.

Reviews.Title: “Good for an airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: bvonm
Reviews.Content: This hotel was well suited as an airport hotel - close to the airport and not much else. Free shuttle service was nice, as was the free wireless and business center (with a printer, which was handy for printing off boarding passes, etc). There is an attached restaurant with food that is palatable, shuttle service is friendly and reliable. The rooms are decent, with unusually nice, obviously renovated bathrooms with nice showers and ours had a tub too. Our TV didn't work. Pool was nice too for a refreshing dip (nice and warm too), lobby was comfortable as well.

Reviews.Title: “I plan to stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Bob33235
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because it was a Best Western Hotel and it was close to the Airport. We arrived at the airport and the shuttle took us to the hotel. We were able to check in early. The desk clerk, Maneel Fernandez was very helpful. He told us how to get downtown on public transportation for 1,40 euros. We stayed 3 nights. We will return next week from a week in Malaga and stay there again. Then when we return from our cruise, we will stay there again. It is very convenient, and Manuel Fernandez was a big help with his knowledge of the area.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best hotel for families”
Reviews.Author: lubi930
Reviews.Content: Guess this is an instance of..."I should have done a little more research". While the hotel itself was fine - it was clean, modern, and the staff were very pleasant to work with, this hotel truly is near absolutely nothing. It is only about a 10 minute drive to the airport, but it's located in the midst of a highly industrial area and you can't' walk to anywhere. We were there for just one day following our cruise - but it was a long day. We didn't really feel like going into Barcelona city (there is a bus that leaves from just outside of the hotel that takes you straight into the city) because we had just gotten off of an 11 day cruise and our flights were leaving the following morning at 6:30am. We were looking forward to a low-key day and hanging out at the hotel pool. Well, hotel pool was closed for repair - we were told it might reopen midday, didn't actually reopen until about 6:30 in the evening. Room service was good - but coming from the states - hours were odd - 1pm-4pm and then again 8pm - 11pm. We also ate in the hotel bar area - pizza was good. Only other complaint I would have is that the rooms were hot and it seemed that you couldn't lower the temp. We opened our window during the day, but we couldn't open at night because there was too much street noise from the trucks passing. Lastly, there is free wi-fi, but you can only access it from the lobby. The signal was not strong enough for me to get even in my 2nd floor room. I feel that this is a hotel aimed at the business traveler who just needs a place to stay for one night before or after a flight.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, Fantastic rooms”
Reviews.Author: MKTravels5
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because it is close to the airport & provides a shuttle for convenient pick up and drop off. What we didn't know was how lovely it would be. The lobby is clean and welcoming with a warm and friendly staff. There is a small business area with 2 computers and a printer so you can print your boarding pass. The bar and dining room are cozy and very nice. The hallways smelled of smoke and we were worried what the room would be like. What a pleasant surprise! The rooms have recently been renovated and the furnishings were clean and comfortable. The bathroom was great, a very contemporary design with a full tub and wonderful shower. If you need to be near the Barcelona airport this is the place to be.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect if you need to be close to the airport!”
Reviews.Author: MinnesnowtaTravelBug
Reviews.Content: We spent our final night in Barcelona at the Best Western Alfa and it was perfect for just that - a good nights sleep, minutes away from the airport in order to accommodate an early morning flight. Do not stay at this hotel if you are looking to be close to the action! It is in a very industrial area and therefor not conducive for convenience in exploring all Barcelona has to offer...however, if you are looking for a comfortable/clean final nights rest before you head home, this is the place to be! We chose the Alfa because it had parking for our rental car and was near the airport. They also offer complimentary shuttle service beginning very early in the morning. The hotel was clean, modern, had a good restaurant and free wifi (the best internet service we had all week actually!). Staff are very nice, rooms are clean and modern. We checked in around 8pm, had dinner, went to bed and checked out at 7am. Perfect. Note - while the Alfa is close to the airport, the airport is very spread out and it takes quite a while to navigate if you need to drive to Terminal 1, which we did. Give yourself extra time.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Location”
Reviews.Author: Joanie39_10
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with all the services present that are advertised. Room clean and comfy, bath very modern and clean. Staff with one exception very business like but helpful and approachable. Exception was morning desk clerk who forgot to give us a wake up. Since this is an airport hotel I regard this omission as a real flaw. He then attempted to hide his error. The hotel is at least a 15 minute drive on various expressways so I am guessing it is about 6 to 10 miles from terminal. Tryp is closer, but didn't see any other "airport" hotel while driving to Best Western. Hotel is not as large (only 4 stories) or as roomy as it appears in the picture. It has no curb appeal, being simply a block of rooms. This is a travelers or a salesmen hotel, complete, comfy, some frills, but definitely not the Four Seasons or The Plaza! Now the BIG problem. There is a toll booth right next to the hotel and it is has 4 lane roads on two sides. It is a truck route so all evening you could hear trucks down shifting or accelerating. Cars would also be picking up speed, so more like interstate traffic than city streets. This meant we could not open the windows without getting blasted by sound. But windows were very tight so when shut the traffic noise was almost non existent. Would recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Not as advertized”
Reviews.Author: Imjin42
Reviews.Content: According to my GPS, it was 10 kilometers to Terminal 1, which was still convenient. The room was hot as the cooling did not work. The bar and restaurant was so warm that you could not enjoy spending any time there. We had to open the windows to cool the room and it is so noisy that you could not sleep. The book in the room describing services is a joke. The TV advertized movies and other features which did not work. Also the services book indicates you could have room service, but after being transferred several times on the telephone, we were told that no room service is available. We spent several days in the middle of Barcelona and then several in France before returning the day before our flight. We had a rental car and choose this hotel due to its location near the airport.

Reviews.Title: “nice facilities for business residence, location needs taxi”
Reviews.Author: Thanassis1974
Reviews.Content: nice hotel for business, the location was out of interest, yet interesting for me to stay in an industrial zone for two nights.

Reviews.Title: “Industrial area-no restaurant around”
Reviews.Author: inconel738
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Best Western to catch a flight next morning. This hotel claimed 2 km away from the airport on several hotel booking website but it's actually 10.3km. We thought the hotel shuttle is available but when we arrived Barcelona airport, the reception said we have to wait for 45 min. We ends up taking the cab. By the cab meter, the charge was EURO10.30 (which you will know it's not 2 km) . We were charged flat rate EURO20.00 because it's from the airport. It is in an industrial area. Absolutely no restaurant around. You pretty much can eat only in the hotel. Not a lot of choice though. The dinner/room service was served at 8:30pm only. The bar only served cold sandwich or snack. My suggestion is having some food in the airport before heading to the hotel. However, if you are not a food person, the room rate of EURO55 is great in Barcelona. The bath room is very modern. The room is clean. The sound proof of the hotel is not very good. We can hear the family knocking the door and talking on the hall way. Luckily, it quiet down after 10:30pm.

Reviews.Title: “Super value and service in convenient airport location.”
Reviews.Author: Garypone
Reviews.Content: What I look for in a hotel is cleanliness, courteous behavior, airport shuttle, room size, un-cramped toilet size, solid breakfast and lobby meeting tables along with the usual amenities (fridge) in room. I was pleasantly surprised that this facility provided at a very competitive price all of the above.The only difficulty I had was the internet service from my room however the lobby worked well. A sign of care is when the hotel owner a "MAC" fan personally assisted me in resolving some connection issues.That doesn't happen too often however further confirmation of trying to satisfy the patrons.Bravo!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: lcpholidays
Reviews.Content: I think this is the greates hotel I could have stayed in. THought it was too far, and that this could be an issue, but to be honest it was not. They have buses to take you in and from Barcelona, hotel is clean, rooms are s nice, also the lobby looks great and makes you feel at home. THey also have a very nice restaurant called Mediterrani where you can eat very nice and typical food. We stayed in a suite, the bathrooms are awsome. I strongly recommend this hotel, it is close to Mercabarna so of coure for any traveller working there is the best option, but also for leisure travellers as myself, this is also a great option due that you have free transportation to the city center several times a day I believe, we left in the morning and came back late in the evening for dinner in the great Mediterrani, it is weird to find a nice restaurant withinhj a hotel as they usually are no good at all.

Reviews.Title: “Best western”
Reviews.Author: DominiqueW1
Reviews.Content: good hotel, design rooms well equipped the people speak english and even the taxi driver took his time to explain a few things.

Reviews.Title: “I would certainly come back”
Reviews.Author: happytobetheone
Reviews.Content: I and my colleagues stayed in Best Western Alfa Aeropuerto and I would like to recommend it. I arranged a small conference over there which was very significant for my business operation and it was a success partly thanks to the hotel services and great amenities as well as its pleasant atmosphere. We all felt very good staying there and I would certainly come back. Look in Last minute travel web site, I booked the hotel over there for less than 70 $ a night for a double room!

Reviews.Title: “Noce hotel..but away from the city”
Reviews.Author: NeetaRamnath
Reviews.Content: The hotel was basic, but comfortable. Some things one must keep in mind while booking the hotel..It is far from the main city, and the only public transport is a bus (whose frequency is every 1/2 hour) apart from taxis. The food options in their restaurant are limited - especially for a vegetarian like me. And there is no other restaurant in the vicinity.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice for an Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: scmommy8
Reviews.Content: We arrived very late from Nice so we decided to just stay at the airport hotel. We got a great rate on the room through Expedia (80 Euro/night). The hotel was very nice - clean, big rooms, nice bathrooms. The biggest negative was getting there. Even though there is a shuttle to and from the airport, we arrived too late to use it. We ended up taking a cab and getting charged way more than we should have (obviously this is not the hotel's fault). The bar/restaurant was closed when we got there, but fortunately there was a mini bar with some water, Coke, beer, etc., which was nice and as we found out the next day, actually reasonably priced as far as minibars go. There was free high speed internet which was nice. The next morning the receptionist was very helpful and showed us where to catch the bus to get into town. For an airport hotel, it was very nice. We stayed in downtown Barcelona the next night which I would recommend if you are doing sightseeing there, but in terms of staying by the airport before or after a flight, it was great!

Reviews.Title: “costs too much to stay at cheap airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Swans37
Reviews.Content: Our travel agent booked the hotel for $285/ two nights near the airport because she probably made a profit from it but for us it wasn't worth it. We waited 45 minutes for the shuttle to pick us up, but we couldn't figure out why it took so long when the hotel is nearby. The cab to the city from the hotel costs 20 euros ($30 - but the cab driver ripped us off and charged us 27 euros and gave me the wrong change actually costing me $60 one way ) and we got lost trying to find the bus. The man at the front desk always seemed peeved at the mobs of people asking him for something or another. There was a long wait to check-in, check-out, or ask for anything because there was only one person at the front desk. There was one computer with access to the internet which was free but there was always someone using it so I couldn't get online. The dining area was small but the dinner was expensive $25-60. We ate pizza at the bar, there were no restaurants in the area. This hotel is located in the middle of nowhere.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here if you have a choice”
Reviews.Author: Daytripper15
Reviews.Content: Had an eight hour layover, booked a "hotel airport" for convenience and a little sleep. Waited 30 minutes for shuttle; told by other shuttle drivers they stop earlier then other shuttles. Had to take a 25 euro taxi to hotel. The location is horrendous; at the intersection of a major airport feeder road and an industrial road; all night long trucks sounds were heard; breaking and shifting; I was on the top floor and the noise kept me from sleeping. In the morning it took 45 minutes from the hotel to my terminal. That is not what I was expecting from a "Aeropuerto" hotel. So, not a convenient location and a very, very, very noisy hotel. Would have had better sleep in airport.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable room and very fine cuisine, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: wisesongbird
Reviews.Content: I found the hotel quite lovely. Staff is exceptional and English speaking at the desk which was especially helpful to me as my Spanish is very rusty. The room and bath were great., exceptionally clean. First time I had used room key to activate electrical in my room - quite efficient! Dining room served excellent food (only had one dinner there), though a bit pricey. The small bar/cafe area also served food and beverage at convenient times. When I booked, the website said hotel shuttle to city center, however this has been discontinued. There is a bus #21 which will take you to the wharf area and then several block walk to La Ramblas which is a wonderful boulevard to browse and relax. The access to ONE computer was never available and was even down for part of my brief two night stay. And if you have an early morning flight, as I did, the airport shuttle service is unavailable. Taxi fare was exhorbitant and hotel is only few minutes from the airport. I paid equivalent of $40 to travel from hotel to airport at 4:15AM. As I am advanced in age, the taxis were much used and quite expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price for a nice hotel..ok location too...very modern interior”
Reviews.Author: funworldtraveler1
Reviews.Content: The hotel had a free shuttle from airport so that was nice....the was 6 in our party me and 5 kids 18,13,12,11,9 ,,, we arrived at the hotel early at 9am and they let us check in early...the pool open at 9 so the kids swam for little while, the pool was small but enough for europe... The 21 bus stop was right in front of the door and it took you straight to parallel stop on the red line which is walking distant. to the world trade ctr. The room was very nice it slept 3 and i found the best rate on best western site with a aaa rate. i WOULD stay there again if i returned...Best part was the rate and location to transportation...the bus took 30 min to get to town which didn't seem bad if you are just going in town in the morning and spending the day there. theres no night life there but the last bus leave town at midnight and gets you back at 1230..lastly be careful getting off at the right stop at night, we made that mistake and costs us a 30 min wait for the next bus.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Fine for 1 night”
Reviews.Author: roslynpines
Reviews.Content: Actually nicer than I expected. Great bathroom with a decent bedroom. We had 3 rooms for our party of 8. We all had morning flights and this was our best option. This hotel is only to be used as an airport pit stop. Enjoyed drinks and tapas in the lounge staffed by a pleasant young women. Used the free computer in the lobby for boarding passes. Our rooms too, were hot. The air conditioning filters are totally packed with dust. We removed our filter and spent a pleasantly cool evening. The hallways have been finished in a marbleized stucco technique I have seen used well, in high end homes. Unfortunately the yellow tone chosen comes across more like walls that have had their wall paper removed.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel to crash in before or after flight”
Reviews.Author: lovetotraveleurope_9
Reviews.Content: Stayed here our last night to be near the airport for morning flight. Beautiful hotel, free wi-fi in lobby with computer and printer to print out boarding pass. Restaurant was excellent. Staff very friendly. Cost very reasonable. Drawback is that while there's an easy free shuttle to take you to and from airport, there is nothing else around for tourists. No restaurants. Nothing. One can take a commercial bus into town, but if you're tired it's a hassle. We chose to remain in hotel and eat supper and breakfast there.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay if you are flying out of BCN early”
Reviews.Author: Wining_Traveller
Reviews.Content: I had a nice stay at this Best Western near the Barcelona airport. It served my purpose well: I flew in late and flew out early the next day. Not a good place to stay if you want to sight see in Barcelona. The shuttle took a little while to arrive at the airport but that was fine. The staff were efficient and pleasant. My room was clean, modern and fairly roomy for European standards. The hotel has been recently renovated. My only issues was that I could hear the TV from the room across the hall when I went to bed. Otherwise, I had a pleasant stay. The breakfast buffet was very good for 14 euros and it only took about 15 minutes to get to the airport in the morning. Compared to the other airport hotel I stayed at in Barcelona, this one was very good. The price was reasonable and I would recommend this one to travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, good services”
Reviews.Author: ctwaternut
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed only one night here because we used this hotel to get us close to the airport for the following day's departure. We had no problem with the excellent shuttle service provided free to the airport. Our room was very nice and clean. The hotel offered free internet service that we were able to use to print our boarding passes. It is in a difficult location to find; we spent an extra 20 min. in a taxi trying to find the hotel. We were very pleased with the wake up call, shuttle to the airport, and free internet services. I would recommend this hotel as a great place to stay if wanting a place close to the airport. This would not be a good location for someone who wants to take in all the sights of Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value For Money”
Reviews.Author: MLSBordeaux
Reviews.Content: Our overnight stay here for only 45.00 was excellent. Positive points - excellent bedroom and in particular the bathroom was superb, shuttle bus to airport frequent and free, reasonable priced food and drinks, clean. Negative points - Had to wait long time at checkin as group were checking in at same time ( would have been nice if someone had acknowledged that we were not part of the group ), Little noisy at night but not too late, Location not excellent but ok as an overnight stopover for airport

Reviews.Title: “Close to airport”
Reviews.Author: PRChinoHills
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Best Western as we were simply there for a lay over. The hotel is very close to the airport, but if you are not able to contact the hotel to have them pick you up, it will cost you approximately 25 euros as we were told there is a minimum that they must charge. We had no problem reserving our shuttle the next morning. Check in was speedy. Our room was on the 3rd floor and was a pretty good sized room. It looked like the bathroom had recently been remodeled. It was very contemporary and a good size as well. They had your standard shampoos and beauty kits which was nice. They also have hairdryers which is a plus. The room was quiet. We didn't partake in the restaurant but the prices seemed pretty reasonable. The hotel is really not near any shops and is not near the metro so if simply staying for one night- it's no problem. If you're there to visit downtown Barcelona, I would not recommend it. We had pre-paid our hotel and upon check-out, did not have any problems.

Reviews.Title: “Scary Shuttle Experience”
Reviews.Author: jilloe
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for the last night of a three week trip around Europe. I was by myself at that point, and I only went back to Barcelona to catch my return flight to the U.S. Having stayed in some pretty nice Best Westerns, I figured this would be a perfectly satisfactory place to spend the night. My flight from London arrived in Barcelona at around 10 pm, and it was nearly midnight before I got to the hotel. I watched other hotel shuttles circle around three and four times before the Hotel Alfa van came, and the only thing that prevented me from just going to another hotel was that I had paid for the room in advance. Once the shuttle finally arrived, I boarded with three other men who were apparently inebriated. As a female traveling by myself, I was a little uncomfortable with the situation and just wanted to get to the hotel as quickly as possible. However, instead of going directly to the hotel, we for some reason still unknown to me, stopped along the way in an abandoned car dealership for about five minutes, listening to something on the radio in Catalan. Perhaps it was some type of sporting event? In any case, I was convinced that I was going to be raped, murdered, or both because it is pretty darn sketchy when a hotel shuttle doesn't bring you directly to the hotel. Nothing actually did happen, but it was still one of the scariest moments of my life. Even if I ended up at the nicest hotel on earth after that, I still would have extremely negative associations with this hotel. As other reviews have mentioned, the hotel itself is mediocre. I didn't have any particular problems with the room (or the return shuttle trip), but I certainly was expecting a nicer hotel. At the very least, all I wanted was a direct, uninterrupted shuttle ride from the airport to the hotel that didn't instill the fear of God in me! I wish that I had just taken a taxi back to the Hotel Apart Silver, where I stayed during my actual visit to Barcelona. I probably would have gotten there faster, and it was a fabulous hotel (not to mention that some of the rooms were cheaper than the Best Western!)

Reviews.Title: “Good airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: HarshadDASWANI
Reviews.Content: As far as airport hotels go, this one was good. It was located a few minutes away from the airport and here is our review! :) 1) When you arrive you have to CALL the hotel to send the shuttle, which is free, but if you dont call, you could be hanging out for a while. 2) If your flight departs very early in the morning the shuttle does not work, which is fine, but a taxi is expensive, almost Euro 30 so keep that in mind ... 3) The hotel has a VERY good restuarant and we enjoyed dinner & breakfast and the staff was very friendly and we enjoyed their service. The hotel has wifi and the lobby decor very contemporary. 4) The rooms are good, well sized, and the bath was nice with good pressure. 5) There is nothing around the hotel to walk to (as would be expected at an airport hotel) so if you're trying to base yourself from there to see Barcelona, it will not be a good idea.

Reviews.Title: “A little piece of heaven after a week in a basic apartment!”
Reviews.Author: BooBunny123
Reviews.Content: We ended up staying here for one night before we flew home from Barcelona, after a nightmare with our transfers. When the taxi was coming up towards the hotel, I saw a big sign on the top of the building with the name of the hotel which made it look like it was something from the 1970s! It looks awful... but when we finally pulled up outside, my fears were forgotten... it was lovely! The reception was a modern area with sofas and a couple of Apple Mac computers for public use. The staff spoke good English as well as Spanish and were welcoming and helpful. There was even a free shuttle bus to take us to the airport the next morning (they also run a free shuttle bus into Barcelona city centre and back!). The bedroom was lovely! It was spacious, with 2 large single beds put together to make a double. Air conditioning and all the mod cons as you would expect from a 4star hotel. The bathroom was stunning - black granite tiles, with a white marble modern sink. The bath was sunken and put behind the sink, with a massive square shower head. I would definitely come back to this hotel - 10 mins from BCN airport and with the free shuttle into the city, I am considering using it for a city break in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Scorchio? ...we don't care!”
Reviews.Author: chris036
Reviews.Content: As with many other reviewers, I found problems with the BW Alfa. I'll start with some good points... • good breakfast buffet, well presented and ample selection • clean and modern lobby with 2 free internet booths • free shuttle service to/from BCN airport • excellently presented bathrooms with neat sinks However, the bad points far outweigh the good... • shuttle is unreliable, takes a long time and the area is dreadful • hotel is located miles from anywhere yet still noisy • rooms are the hottest in Europe • advertised air con, but does not cool the room • swimming pool accessed by freight elevator • Apple PCs in lobby not compatible with many websites • staff dreadful, when I complained of lack of A/C and that I could not breathe, the reception clerk simply stated 'it's not a condition' over and over. I wasn't offered another room, and they have no fans to cool the room either BW have a hotchpotch of Hotels around the world, and in my varied experience it's pretty much 50/50 - annoying though, as there is no apparent standard. I do hope BW read these reviews and maintain better standards in future - my Gold Card will not be adding any points if not! Give this one a miss, their staff attitude ruined my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Functional”
Reviews.Author: FamilyP_Yorks
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel as we have a vehicle over 2.1metres high and couldn't find anywhere else in Barcelona to park it. It is on the edges of the fruit/veg market (for this read main HGV distribution area), not by the airport as expected. The room was small, but clean and functional. The 'pool' about the size of anyone else's jacuzzi and facilities poor. On the plus side, the staff helpfully advised on ways to get into Barcelona (there's a bus stop immediately outside). I would certainly not recommend the hotel! We'd have been better parking the Land Rover at the airport and using a hotel in the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Use only for overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: jofromab
Reviews.Content: Just booked one night prior to a cruise. Front Desk rude check-in and check-out. Industrial area. Restaurant expensive and limited times. Stayed after checking rates for hotels and cabs/transfers. A triple room is harder to find and much more expensive then a twin. No regular cab could take 3 passengers plus 5 large suitcases, so the shuttle worked the best for us. The hotel shuttle was fine. The room was ready with the extra cot, new and clean. Faced the front, but must have been too tired to hear the noise. Free internet and 2 computers for guest use.

Reviews.Title: “Only stay here as a last resort...”
Reviews.Author: croftta
Reviews.Content: I've found in the past that Best Western hotels can be a mixed bad. Some are good, some are questionable. I was at a conference in the city and as a result of an admin 'issue' my company didn't book my hotel until the last minute - the Alfa was the only hotel available. The hotel is located some 15 minutes drive from the Airport on the edge of an industrial estate. Inside it is modern and clean with good Wi-Fi access across all rooms (though this was down the first day I was there). Those are the good points My problems started on arrival at the Airport with the supposedly 'regular' shuttle. After waiting over half an hour I gave the hotel a call. They said it was 15 mins away. 15 mins later it went sailing straight past Terminal B as it had a full load from Terminal A. It was some 30 mins later, and after another call, that I was eventually picked up. Throughout my stay the bus proved unreliable and difficult to rely upon. The advertised free service into Barcelona centre is one-way only, and they refuse to pick anyone up on the 2nd drop even though they're going back to the hotel!
