I was given a no-smoking room on check-in, but when I got to the room it STANK of cigarette's. When I complained, they insisted on walking with me to the room to check out my claims. Only very grumpily (this attitude was representative of the staff attitudes) did they give me another room which was actually a smoking room, but smelt better!! Apparently the locals don't take any notice of no-smoking rules! The bathroom is very nice to look at, being of a modern design, but mine stank of drains/sewers. I loved the design of the sink, but realised how impractical it was when I saw there was no way of filling up the sink as there was no conventional plug hole. You also got a good spray back if you turned on the tap too much, and the step was a real trip hazard. The "air conditioning" was non-existent and the room was overly warm, and this was November, heaven knows what it would be like in summer! You couldn't have the window open as heavy vehicles outside woke you up, and the walls were paper thin. More seriously for me was that I had to rely on taxi's to get me into the centre - it is nowhere near Barcelona's excellent metro system. Some taxi drivers were good but some obviously tried to fleece tourists. A popular move seems to be to add 'surcharges' for going outside the city limits, or it being a Sunday, when other drivers hadn't applied them! About a third didn't seem to know where it was, even given the address (and many had SatNav!!). Checking out took me 45 mins as the bill was dubious to say the least. With a supposed corporate B&B rate, they had charged me for breakfast which they refused to budge on. Stay at a hotel in the ciry - it's cheaper, nicer and with the train service to the airport quicker!!!

Reviews.Title: “bad, bad, bad & Bad”
Reviews.Author: blubs99
Reviews.Content: This hotel is AWFUL! Stayed one night as we were in Barcelona overnight to make a connection, and this property is listed as 4 stars. The free shuttle van took over 30 minutes to pick us up, then the driver unloaded our luggage on the hotel driveway and walked away. The front desk person told us there was no staff to help with our luggage. Room was tiny, never had hot water (only warm) and the door to our room was so thin all sounds from other rooms and the corridor were heard, in fact if someone knocked on any door near our room we thought it was our room. This hotel is seriously over-rated and Best Western should be ashamed to recommend this hotel or to advertise as a 4-star hotel. Finally: Location! This property is a 15 minute drive to the airport in a simply awful part of Barcelona in an industrial area.

Reviews.Title: “Bad, bad, bad”
Reviews.Author: callmelordjim
Reviews.Content: Let me keep it simple and direct: --NOT near the airport. Horrible location in fact. --No concept of customer service. --Poorly managed restaurant. --Smoke filled. --Unreliable shuttle service. --Unreliable wake up calls. --Cramped rooms. --Minimal amenities. --NO WAY THIS IS A FOUR-STAR HOTEL. --Best Western needs to send someone here as this hotel does a dis-service to the franchise.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid This Place”
Reviews.Author: callmelordjim
Reviews.Content: There is only one reason for this hotel to exist: it is (somewhat) close to the airport and so (somewhat) convenient for early morning flights out of Barcelona. Considering this, the Hotel Alfa is amazingly inept at providing this simple service. After two weeks traveling Spain, we booked the Alfa so we would be close to the airport for our 8 a.m. flight back to the U.S. First of all, the hotel really is NOT all that close to the airport. It is probably 5 miles away and that means a 20-30 Euro cab ride, depending on luggage. Don't depend on the hotel van, it runs when they feel like it. And don't depend on a wake-up call to get you on the road. We checked with the front desk twice before going to bed, and they STILL did not place the wake up call. We had to rush as a result. Remember, this is supposed to be an airport hotel. Wake up calls would seem to be a basic, right? The staff borders on rude. They know they will probably never see you again, and they act that way. We asked for extra pillows; had the front desk clerk simply said "NO," we might not have been surprised. Instead, he drilled us on why we wanted extra pillows and suggested that we actually didn't need them!! Totally nuts. In the end, they never did send the pillows. The rooms, even on the smoke-free floors, are imbued with years of nicotine. The no smoking rule is simply not enforced. Our friends room included sheets that were riddled with cigarette burn marks...on the no smoking floor! The bathrooms are cramped and badly in need of a facelift and include only the bare necessities. The restaurant food was fine, but the service was, without any doubt, the worst we experienced anywhere in Spain. They must be trained by the same people who train the front desk. Again, this place is supposed to be an airport hotel. Quick, good food served with a smile should be the order of the day. They don't even come close. The Alfa bills itself as a four-star hotel. This is an insult to the rating system. It barely deserves a single star. FIND SOMEWHERE ELSE TO STAY when trying to be near the airport in Barcelona. You will thank me.

HotelInfo.Name: BEST WESTERN Alfa Aeropuerto
HotelInfo.Address: Calle K S/N | Zona Franca. Mercabarna., 08040 Barcelona, Spain
